body.hr:
Date: 2011-11-23, 4:50PM EST
Reply to: job-rg4bd-2717799738@craigslist.org[Errors when replying to ads?]
We are an East Orlando start-up looking for software engineers of all experience levels.
Development with us:
You will work in small focussed teams of highly motivated and talented developers
You will be part of a professional stable development environment that is not subject to the long periods of crunch time typically associated with game development
Each developer / programmer will be expected to take responsibility for, and strongly influence the products they develop and the customers they work with
You will have the opportunity to work on and gain experience with the expanding range of hardware platforms we support.
You will have the opportunity to work with some of the best games teams in the industry
Key Responsibilities:
Developing optimized code in C/C++ for the very latest hardware platforms e.g. (PS3,Xbox 360,Wii,PC, Mobile, Android ,iPhone)
Writing cross-platform, multithreaded engine code
Leading and participating in code reviews with other members of the engineering team on a regular basis
Working on all aspects of Software Development including implementation, testing, documentation and delivery
Working directly with product management and customers to understand their requirements and implement software solutions
Developing and maintaining one of the most respected codebases in the games industry
Drafting tutorials, white papers and speaking at technical meetings / conferences
Taking ownership of more general projects/responsibilities within the development team such as recruitment initiatives, presentations and technical relationships with partner companies
Working directly with customers, often on-site, to ensure they are getting the most from our products
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Exceptional C++ skills and experience with Object Oriented Programming technique
Strong communication skills and the ability to work in a team environment
Proven ability to work in a team environment on a shared code base
Desirable skills:
Background in game development
Experience developing 3D graphics applications and tools
Low level optimization skills, experience in middleware and physics
Experience working with established, large-scale software architectures
Experience working within and extending one or more scripting languages (e.g. Python, Perl and/or LUA)
Compensation: Highly competitive
Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.

body.hr:
Date: 2011-11-23, 4:15PM EST
Reply to: job-54kvj-2717740937@craigslist.org[Errors when replying to ads?]
Looking for an exciting & challenging software testing opportunity? Interested in working as part of a small but tight team, at a well-funded and market-ready company that is starting to expand? Prepared to commit to giving 110% in a fast-paced and rewarding environment?
Then you might be the kind of person we need. We are a dynamic organization located in Lake Mary, FL -- part of the growing Orlando Metro area. Our company specializes in providing ticketing and financial software for major recreation and entertainment venues. Our clients include over 30 top theme parks, water parks, and zoos across North America.
We seek a Quality Assurance Analyst who is ready and able to contribute to our QA testing team. Strong communication skills and the ability to work with a team are essential. We move quickly and are looking for someone with excellent problem-solving techniques, plus the ability to have great attention to detail in an Enterprise testing environment. We require self-starters who are able to adapt and are willing to learn the details of testing software in a fast paced software application environment.
Job Description:
The Software Quality Assurance professional will be responsible for testing new feature enhancements, software changes and bug fixes for accesso software applications. The person in this role will have knowledge of testing web based applications, database, and reporting systems as they apply to the Accesso SDLC.
Essential Functions of the Software Quality Assurance Analyst:
Develop, execute and document test plans, scenarios and test cases
for existing and new applications.
Automate test procedures where appropriate, that verify and validate the Accesso Shop, Services and Database.
Help to Maintain the Staging Server environment.
Support weekly updates and software loads to production servers.
Follow established processes for defect management using Test Track.
Interact with Software Engineers to understand application testing
requirements.
Interact with Account Managers and on occasion with the Accesso Clients to understand the objectives of software changes, product requirements or other application related needs in order to adequately facilitate the Quality Assurance process.
Validate that the software being tested complies with OWASP guidelines and PCI Requirements.
Develop knowledge of business processes facilitated by our software application in order to approach the Quality Assurance process with a firm understanding of the software and how it is used by our customers.
Job Requirements:
1-3 years experience within Software Quality Assurance (SQA)
position, preferably within multi-tier, enterprise software
environment.
1+ year experience setting up and troubleshooting the installation
of multi-tier, enterprise applications.
1+year of experience with at least one scripting language in a Linux or Windows environment.
1+ year experience with at least 1 high level programming language,
such as; C, C++, C#, VB, Java or other scripting language.
Some working knowledge of MySQL Server, T-SQL and
demonstrated understanding of relational database architectures.
1+ year experience of writing and executing test cases for reporting
and web based systems.
2+ year experience with Windows and Linux Operating System environments.
Experience developing and executing test scripts for automation
tools is a strong plus.
Experience with defect management processes is a strong plus
Location: Lake Mary
Compensation: Negotiable
Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.

body.hr:
Date: 2011-11-23, 1:52PM EST
Reply to: job-rhem4-2717483858@craigslist.org[Errors when replying to ads?]
####
To Apply, please solve our challenge question here: http://www.codeeval.com/public_sc/53/
####
Web Developer/Backend Engineer at an Early Stage Stealth Start-up
Helping people discover new experiences.
We are a start-up located in San Francisco that helps people find new, unique experiences and activities in their city based on their interests and personality. Our team is focused on building great products that change the way people think about their free time.
We are an early-stage VC-funded company looking to bring on excellent talent with competitive salary and equity options. You will have a chance to work directly with the founders and be part of the core team (8-10 people).
We are looking for a backend engineer with the ability to build excellent web and/or mobile products. Real-world experience is preferred (this means you have worked on creating web products from start to finish - either in the professional setting or as side projects).
Required skills:
+ Willingness and ability to pick up new programming languages
+ Ruby on Rails
+ Javascript/JQuery
+ CSS/HTML
+ MySQL
+ Amazon Web Services
+ UNIX/Linux
+ Easy going
Bonus points:
+ Web scraping technologies
+ node.js
+ Objective C (iOS dev)
+ Experience scaling servers (caching/optimization)
+ Machine learning
You will work directly with the CTO, who handles most of the back-end programming, on a daily basis, and deploy product updates on a regular basis. Your responsibilities are primarily Rails programming, but you will be expected to work on whatever is necessary at the time.
If you fit the bill, solve our challenge here: http://www.codeeval.com/public_sc/53/
Location: San Francisco, CA
Compensation: Market Rate

Who we are
Shopply is an internet startup that aims to simplify online shopping.
We're 2nd time entrepreneurs and were previously funded by Sequoia Capital and Eric Schmidt's VC firm. We're Stanford MBAs and Cornell CS Masters alums and we've worked at eBay, Google, McKinsey and Accenture.
We're in stealth and are targeting a big ($30+ billion) and growing market. We are now building out the product and have funding commitments from top tier investors.
What's like to work here

body.h2: Software Engineer level II(C++ and Java) (Olrando, FL)
body.hr:
Date: 2011-11-22, 3:07PM EST
Reply to: job-yvsvn-2715969373@craigslist.org[Errors when replying to ads?]
$65k-$77k
Description:
The candidate will be a mid level software developer to support the design, development, integration and test of software for simulation/gaming applications in support of military/commercial training.
Responsibilities:
Possesses and applies a broad knowledge of principles, practices, and procedures of software development to the completion of assignments.
Works on the overall design and development of software products as well as software applications.
Responsible for establishing, conducting, and documenting software testing based on customer requirements.
Develops new software engineering methods or processes, and re-evaluate existing processes.
Able to work in a fast-paced production environment with ability to handle multiple competing tasks and demands simultaneously.
Understands and adheres to cost targets established during the program design phase.
Provides documentation of work and results.
Review projects tasks against the schedule and provides status reports to the Program Manager.
Work as part of a software development team.
Implementation and application of sound configuration management processes and adherence to software CM and development policy and procedures.
Able to travel to customer locations to support contractual commitments including data collection, program reviews, software development, software deliveries, installation and test.
Complete assigned projects within estimated cost, schedule commitments, and verify they meet or exceed the contractual reliability and performance requirements.
Supports development and executing of project plans as directed by the Program Manager.
Monitor and manage program schedules to ensure timely completion of tasks.
Maintains a schedule related to assigned task status and completion dates.
Supplement existing engineering staff in development, integration & test of simulation software and systems.
Support proposal efforts to include estimating level of effort for the design, development, and testing of software.
Responsible for completion of tasks on schedule and within budget.
Keep programs and managers aware of task status.
Support and utilize defined processes and procedures to facilitate program objectives.
Mentoring junior software engineers.
Support new business development efforts.
Tasks:
Design, modify, develop, implement, and test software applications with minimal direction.
Work with team members to support project software development.
Research, evaluation, development and application of new process and methods into software products.
Design software test criteria/procedures and verify functionality and performance.
Supports and/or install software applications/operating systems.
Participates in the testing process through test review and analysis, test witnessing and verification of software.
Support the review of customer??s specification and other documentation to determine software engineering requirements and develop the appropriate software design to satisfy those requirements.
Reviews and analyzes system specifications related to software development.
Analyzes existing systems and subsystems for reusability benefits and needed changes.
Support design documentation development.
Participate in presentations of technical findings, design, and development.
Develop detailed design documentation consistent with industry standards.
Support proposal development efforts.
Maintains the AVT software CM repositories as well as serve as administrator for the system as required.
Support installation efforts that will require travel CONUS and OCONUS.
Support special assignments and demonstrations as required.
Experience:
At least 5 - 10 years of professional software development experience in the modeling and simulation field is required.
Experience shall include software design, development, integration, and testing.
Experience in software testing both internally and with customers is required.
Software design (UML, class diagrams, and sequence diagrams) and documentation experience required.
Experience with software CM tools required, Subversion desired.
This position requires someone who has experience and capability to write software using C++ and Java for Linux and Windows Operation Systems.
Experience with C4I, specifically C2 systems is desired.
Familiarity with USMC Joint Tactical Common Operational Picture is desirable.
Experience with Combat Operations Center (COC) Capability Set (CS) and Tactical Combat Operations (TCO) Program of Record (PoR) workstation solutions. Specific tasks will generally include:
- Working Problem Trouble Reports (PTR)/Software Trouble Reports
(STR)
- Build Management
Military training and simulation background/experience.
Experience with: LINUX, Windows XP, DIS v7, C++, JAVA, XML, VBS2, OneSAF
Desirable:
HLA experience
Familiarity with the following: TRAC, OpenGL, 3D game development
CACCTUS Experience
Education:
Completion of a full course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a Bachelor's or higher degree in computer science, computer engineering or a related field.
Substitution:
Four (4) years of professional experience can be substituted for two (2) years of the educational requirements.
* US Government security clearance will be required.
Location: Olrando, FL
Compensation: $65k-$75k

Seeking a Java Application Tester for a 3 month contract with a major international firm. This position is in the Regional Company - Siemens Corporation - Global Shared Services business unit.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Debugs complex software products through the use of systematic tests to develop, apply and maintain quality standards for company products.
Develops and executes complex software test plans.
Analyzes and writes complex test standards and procedures.
Completes and maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of complex software.
Performs analysis of test results to ensure functionality and recommends corrective action.
Completes the logging, tracking, communication, and resolution of issues.
REQUIREMENTS
BS/BA in related discipline, or advanced degree, where required, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
2+ years of successful experience using automated testing frameworks.
2+ years of experience creating test plans and test cases.
Knowledge and/or experience with custom Java applications and understanding SQL is required.
Crystal Reports experience is a plus.
This is a drug free workplace. Selected candidates will be required to pass a drug screen and background check.
If you are interested, please send your resume, cover letter, and 2 references that can be verified by phone and email. Only qualified candidates will be contacted! No H1B processing is available.
Requisition: 10274
Location: Orlando, FL
Job Title: Java Application Tester
Pay Rate: $ 38.84 / hr
Assignment Duration: 3 month contract.
PLEASE USE THE FOLLOWING SUBJECT LINE FOR ALL EMAIL
10274 -- Java Application Tester -- Your Name
Location: Orlando
Compensation: $ 38.84 / hr
This is a contract job.

RoR Software Engineer
####
To apply, please solve our challenge here:
http://www.codeeval.com/public_sc/45/
####
picture, is seeking an energetic, passionate, creative and analytical Ruby on Rails
developer to contribute in the creation of our current and next generation products.
You will be our first in-house developer, and your work will be a key part of our
exciting cutting-edge web-based applications. You will use your experience to
create and innovate new solutions on a daily basis, which will be developed and
released within weeks. If you're the right person for the job, you'll grow quickly
within the position and expand your responsibilities to include managing others
involved in the effort.
The Ruby on Rails Developer will be responsible for building high-quality web
software with the Ruby on Rails framework, maintaining existing web properties,
and participating in the planning/creative phase for new projects. Must be able to
write maintainable, reusable code, always accompanied by solid software tests. The
Rails Developer will report to the Director of Technology.
Skills & Requirements
Skills:
Build and maintain a variety of applications and products built on the Ruby on
Rails framework using Rails and MySQL
Participate in the application architecture and design phases by working
collaboratively with other team members
Maintain quality code standards and industry best practices
Write software tests for new code
Work with defined version control and deployment strategies
Qualifications:
3 Years Experience developing applications for web
Knowledge of server administration/deployment strategies
Experience in implementing performance testing metrics
Knowledge of MySQL
jQuery knowledge a plus
Experience with Git
Knowledge of common Ruby libraries
And finally . . .
You must have a willingness to work your ass off and do whatever it takes to
execute under tight deadlines. The hours can be irregular and unpredictable,
including work at night and on weekends, and it's important that you're comfortable
with that. The person we are looking to hire will be working from our SOMA
WeWork location.
As part of the WeWork team, you're going to be able to be a part of and enjoy in
the growth of a super fun, fast-paced and exciting start-up company with lofty
ambitions. We offer a competitive salary and unlimited room for growth and
personal development.
To apply:
Please send us an email introducing yourself and include your resume:
xxx@wework.com.
Please also include a link to your portfolio, or past work that you think is
relative to the position.
Please do not call, as the person answering the phone will have do idea who
you are and will not be able to direct you to anyone to talk.
Unfortunately, we will not be able to respond to all applicants.
Thanks for your interest in WeWork!
Location: San Francisco, CA
Compensation: Market Rate

Seeking a PeopleSoft Business Analyst, for a 3 month contract to hire position with a major international firm. This position is in the Regional Company - Siemens Corporation - Global Shared Services business unit.
We are looking for someone with PeopleSoft - Human Capital Management (HCM) experience, NOT Financials
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Perform HR/Payroll functional applications analysis, design, testing, and support within the PeopleSoft HCM system, as part of the IT Applications team.
Requirements gathering, functional analysis, design, and system configuration
Project lead at times, central knowledge source on PeopleSoft HCM functionality
Liaison between customer base, HR/Payroll operations, and HRIT
Customer support -- responds to service requests involving a wide range of support needs such as control table setups, PS Query assistance, how to use the application, troubleshooting, analyzing and documenting new report / interface / page requirements for Development, testing completed development work
Coordinates with Development/programming staff
Coordinates all levels of user testing and acceptance
Works with process owners on re-engineering processes supported by technology
Provide application integration knowledge among the various applications modules (ex. HR, Benefits, Payroll, Self-Service applications).
Maintain process documentation, operational procedures, etc.
REQUIREMENTS:
Good theoretical and practical knowledge in application software analysis
Minimum 4 years functional experience with PeopleSoft HCM 8.x , preferably with version 8.9.
PeopleSoft HR/Benefits/Payroll system set up and configuration.
PeopleSoft Self-Service application awareness.
PeopleSoft Query.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
MS-Project, MS-Office.
PeopleSoft Tax Update experience is preferred.
This is a drug free workplace. Selected candidates will be required to pass a drug screen and background check.
If you are interested, please send your resume, cover letter, and 2 references that can be verified by phone and email. Only qualified candidates will be contacted! Relocation costs, travel expenses, per-diem, and H1B processing are not available.

Software Engineer (Adku.com)
#####
To apply, please complete our challenge here: http://www.codeeval.com/public_sc/56/
#####
We're looking for motivated technology generalists who can build products from the ground up. As a generalist, you should feel comfortable working on projects across the board. Projects can cover anything from algorithms and web development to infrastructure and server administration. If you are passionate about building a great company, now is a great time to join.
Responsibilities
Development of maintainable, extendable, and scalable back-end systems
Full-cycle project ownership - covering design, development, testing, and deployment
Active participation in determining product direction
Desired Skills & Experience
Requirements
BA/BS in Computer Science or related fields
Natural curiosity / passion for software development
Bonus points if you have...
Actively contributed to open-source projects
Developed in any of the following: Python, Ruby, Java, C++
Worked with Amazon Web Services (EC2 and S3)
Used/looked into any of the following Python related libraries
Infrastructure/Server Admin - Fabric, pip, boto, Tornado, uWSGI
Misc - Cython, MRJob, cProfile
Web Development - Django, Flask, Jinja2, SQLAlchemy
Perks
Untracked PTO - you trust us, we trust you
Medical, dental, vision
Free lunch
Full bar
Monthly stipend for living nearby
Location: San Francisco, CA
Compensation: Market Rate

Position Responsibilities
Participate in testing sprints, covering multiple storage appliances and HBAs.
Create valid test cases for new and existing features based on Our Client's Development's planning documentation, and later verify correct behavior.
Interface with other departments and office locations to facilitate smooth transfer of information in both directions.
Write test automation scripts to verify expected behavior of Our Client's appliances and HBAs.
Report defects into bug tracking system, work with Development to reproduce problems so that they can be fixed, and verify bug fixes in later builds.
Participate in Support escalations when needed, helping to reproduce problems in-house, and later qualifying patch releases.

Bachelor's degree in a technical area
Team player willing to take on both high-profile and less-than-glamorous assignments
Coding skills in a scripting language like Python or Perl, using ExpectWindows, Linux, and/or Solaris basic administration skills
Basic network administration skills
Knowledge of VMware products highly desirable

body.hr:
Date: 2011-11-22, 11:29AM EST
Reply to: job-zkfhq-2692001276@craigslist.org[Errors when replying to ads?]
Amovius
Amovius is a nontraditional yet incredible place to work! If you are looking for professional career advancement opportunities, cross training in the latest technologies, competitive salary, full health and dental benefits, a casual work environment, and a positive work life balance then look no further than Amovius. You will gain job stability with one of Florida's fastest growing companies. We live and work by our core values which include: respect, integrity, innovation, and teamwork. We value our employees as much as our clients!
OBJECTIVE
The MS Dynamics Great Plains (GP) developer/administrator is responsible for the documentation and support of the current GP environment, and the development of new custom GP components and integration points to other 3rd party applications; including but not limited to Crystal Reports, FRx, and a proprietary custom application developed on the LAMP stack. This includes the setup, maintenance, security, and problem detection/resolution of the GP environments.
RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES
Responsibilities and duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:
Documentation of the current state of the GP environment
Provide suggested future state recommendations and the implementation plan of future state, including but not limited to;
o Compliance gap resolution
o Security best practices
o Disaster Recovery strategies
o Configuration recommendations
Technical support of the GP environment including custom developed components and integrations to 3rd party applications
Development of custom GP components and 3rd party integrations
Other duties as assigned.
EXPERIENCE
Experiences should cover some of the following areas with some knowledge / exposure to the other areas:
A minimum of three (3) years experience in MS Dynamics Great Plains (GP) development, implementation, integration, and support
A minimum of three (3) years experience in Crystal Reports and FRx
Experience in SQL Server development and administration with a focus on GP data structures
Experience in software development technologies such as LAMP and C#.NET
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent conceptual and analytical skills
Experience working in a fast paced multiple project environment on an independent basis and with minimal supervision
EDUCATION
4 year college degree desired
CERTIFICATE/LICENSE
One is required, but highly desirable to have two or more:
Microsoft Certification
Development Language Certifications
PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT
Stay abreast of the latest technological advances as they relate to an information technology environment. Continue in the advancement and study of software development skill sets.
TYPICAL PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS
Requires mobility. Air and car travel, and time away from home may be required. Requires prolonged sitting and standing. Requires ability to communicate by telephone, keyed or printed/written English. Requires the ability to operate office equipment, such as computer, software, copier, pager, cell phone. Requires the ability to distinguish letters, numbers or symbols. Regular, predictable attendance required. Requires the ability to work in a fast paced environment.
amovius.com
Location: Melbourne FL
Compensation: DOE
